task.title: Changing the Java compiler version for a Java EE project
task.shortdesc: You can change the version of Java used in a Java EE project by changing the value of the Java facet.

context.p: The Java facet applies only to J2EE projects. To set the Java compiler level of a non-Java EE project, such as a Java project, see Java Compiler.
To change the Java compiler version, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: In the Project Explorer view of the Java EE perspective, right-click the project and then select Properties.
Select the Project Facets page in the in the Properties window.
step.info: This page lists the facets in the project and their versions.

step.cmd: Double click the version number next to theJava facet to select a different level of Java compiler.
Click Finish to close the Modify Faceted Project window and then click OK.
